column3: You don't have to be an astronomer to enjoy the stars and you don't have to be an architect to wonder at the space that Turrell has provided. Sit and watch the changing colors and shading in the outdoor space and it cannot help but cause a person to re-examine the world we all live in.

You have to spend time here. At dusk. You have to watch the way the changing colors around the sky light intensify your perception of the sky, as it changes colors during dusk and sunset. It is beautiful.
My husband took me here at dusk to see how awesome it is. It is a little hidden gem in the colleges. Check it out when you are visiting the beautiful city of Claremont.
This skyspace allows one to contemplate the relationship between earth and the heaves above. A ever changing tableau is presented through the frame of the skyspace.Presented as only nature can.

Hard to find till you look at a campus map!Mellow little area. Seating around fountain as you wait for lighting and inspirations.Got here early.Colors start at sunset.The contrast of the sky and colors, combined with the sound of the fountain...Way soothing and creates a meditative vibe

It is hard to explain the experience because everyone probably sees it differently. It's cool, surreal, trippy, awesome, beautiful ... I am sure that if you went on different evenings you'd have a different view of the world. You have to go at sunset to get the best perspective.

column2: Amazing combination of metal and sky.
column3: This is an amazing work of art. The lighting and the inclusion of the sky as part of it create an optical illusion that can really throw you off.

column2: Relaxing lights change color as the sun goes down
column3: Relaxing lights change color as the sun goes down. Sit on benches. Free. Located in the middle of Pomona College campus. Orchestrated by a Pomona College alum, James Turrell.
Sublime color changing meditative space (tho currently under refurbishment or something) - always take visitors (when open!)
